q: - Prominent US Republican Sarah Palin on Monday defended her reference to "blood libel" that aroused controversy last week when she used the term to condemn criticism linking her fiery rhetoric to the Arizona shootings. Blood libel obviously means being falsely accused of having blood on your hands. We have judges, but they only judge the response of the audience. A lot of other shows have judges who make that final decision, and they overrule the audience about who stays and who goes. "At the Apollo, however, the crowd actually does the hiring and the firing, and they get pretty wild. Marion J. Mike Pence said this was his first town hall since the Tucson, Ariz., shootings and he always consults with local law enforcement on security at such events. To me the focus is and should remain on public safety. We volunteer for these jobs, but just because someone comes to a town hall meeting, they should never have to be concerned that there's not a reasonable amount of security, he said. He said town hall meetings are "very routine" for him and said he was grateful that everyone came out Monday in the wake of the Tucson shootings.___

The timing will depend on market conditions, Chrysler's financial results and its ability to refinance the government loans, Sergio Marchionne said. Because of these changed market conditions as well as the improvements in our performance and outlook, made possible through the support of the U.S. and Canadian governments, Chrysler intends to repay these loans in full at the earliest opportunity, Sergio Marchionne said in today's statement.
